climbs.name: Through the Looking Glass
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, February 1999

content.description:
Lieback a crack up to a

horizontal crack , then climb the slab past 4 bolts. At the top move up and right up Â to a 2-bolt anchor (90 feet). The crux is just above the 2nd bolt.
content.protection: Rack single from .5 to 3.5 inch (only a few cams needed for gear, as the crack section is short).  Well bolted.
content.location: Route is on the left side of Ginger's Face. Rap the route via the 2-bolt anchor (90 feet).

climbs.name: Tea Party
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Alejandra Uranga, Pedro Uranga, and Josue Molina, Jan. 2020

content.description: Toprope the slab between The Caterpillar and Through the Looking Glass, staying independent of those routes.
content.protection: Easily toproped off the bolt anchor.

climbs.name: The Rabbit Hole
climbs.fa: Pedro Uranga, Josue Molina, Alejandra Uranga, and Bob Gaines, Jan. 2020

content.description: This is the short chimney to the left of the main slab, left of the Caterpillar.
content.protection: 3 to 4 inch CDs are useful to rig the anchor.

climbs.name: Mary Ann or Ginger?
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Mark O'brien, March 2006.

content.description: This is the big slab right of As the Wind Blows. Begin just right of that route and climb steepening rock to a crux area, climbing just right of a small roof. Traverse left above the roof, then climb up the center of the slab.

climbs.name: Guns for Nuns
climbs.fa: Dick Peterson, Mary Hinson, Todd Swain  11/96

content.description: Top rope the face between "Through the Looking Glass" and "Gun for the Sun".
content.protection: Build your own anchor. Climb one of the other routes first.

climbs.name: Gun for the Sun
climbs.fa: Jack Marshall, Don and Karen Wilson 1988

content.description:
Start on corners/cracks to the left of As the Wind Blows obvious corner.

Up through discontinuous cracks up to the first bolt, then a long run to the second bolt (5.9 R). At the top you can climb up and left for an easier finish, or climb staright up (5.10a/b) for a direct finish. 2-bolt anchor (90-foot rap).
content.protection:
Standard rack.  Two bolts.  Note that these bolts are pretty old and buttonheads (although appear to be 3/8" buttonheads) and the second hanger is an old Leeper.  Good candidates for replacement.  Update:  bolts replaced!!

Protection Update/ January 2015

The old bolts have been replaced, thanks to Kevin Powell (and the ASCA for donating the hardware)
content.location: Cracks to face left of obvious corner of As the Wind Blows.

content.description:
This is a short route located in boulders under and slightly left of Gun For the Sun.  Severely overhanging jamming leads to a hard move or two through a flare.

If this route had a flat base, it would be a popular boulder problem.  With the base as it is, it is an enjoyable and very short lead.  Great practice for overhanging jams.
content.protection: A few pieces #.75 Camalot and above.

climbs.name: Chocolate Decadence
climbs.fa: Karen Wilson and Julie White, March 1988

content.description: This clean-looking corner system is awkward to climb, and not much fun.
content.location: This climb is on the north side of the formation, hidden from the trail.  It is a dogleg dihedral, and you need to tunnel under a large chockstone to get to the start.

climbs.name: The Caterpillar
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, March 2010 (TR), Lead, January, 2015

content.description: Start 20 feet left of Through the Looking Glass in a right-facing corner. Lieback the corner past a bolt,then, about half way up the corner, move right and climb the face past 2 bolts (5.8) to the top. There are 2 bolts (somewhat hidden) for a belay/rappel anchor (90 feet) up and right at the top of Gun for the Sun.
Corner crack, somewhat flared and mealy rock.  A bit spicy and listed in the guide as a 5.7.  Would not be a route for a fledgling 5.7 leader.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Old 1/4" bolt/Leeper hanger mid way up route (good candidate for replacement or removal).  Top out then down climb horizontal crack to sling anchor on Through the Looking Glass.
content.location: Obvious left-facing corner to the right of the main Ginger's Face.
